DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Prior Myelodysplastic Syndrome Administration Year Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date, by year, that the prior action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process of myelodysplastic syndrome, a clonal hematopoietic disorder characterized by dysplasia and ineffective hematopoiesis in one or more of the hematopoietic cell lines.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Prior Myelodysplastic Syndrome Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the prior action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process of myelodysplastic syndrome, a clonal hematopoietic disorder characterized by dysplasia and ineffective hematopoiesis in one or more of the hematopoietic cell lines.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) is a clonal hematopoietic disorder characterized by dysplasia and ineffective hematopoiesis in one or more of the hematopoietic cell lines.  The dysplasia may be accompanied by an increase in myeloblasts, but the number is less than 20%, which, according to the WHO guidelines, is the requisite threshold for the diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia.  MDS may occur de novo or as a result of exposure to alkylating agents and/or radiotherapy.  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: A clonal hematopoietic disorder characterized by dysplasia and ineffective hematopoiesis in one or more of the hematopoietic cell lines. The dysplasia may be accompanied by an increase in myeloblasts, but the number is less than 20%, which, according to the WHO guidelines, is the requisite threshold for the diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia. It may occur de novo or as a result of exposure to alkylating agents and/or radiotherapy. (WHO, 2001)
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numeric representation of the calendar year.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
